decks.notes: The key concept of this Aggro - Death And Taxes Modern 1 vs 1 deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure through efficient creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory, while also utilizing creatures like Ephemerate and Recruiter of the Guard to maintain an aggressive stance. Starfield Shepherd and Witch Enchanter provide value through enchantments, further enhancing the deck's synergy. Additionally, cards like Solitude and Quantum Riddler offer flexibility in dealing with threats. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent while quickly closing out the game with powerful creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to cycle through cards quickly using cards like Street Wraith and Subtlety, while cascading into Living End with cards such as Shardless Agent and Steamcore Scholar. The goal is to fill up the graveyard with creatures and then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield, overwhelming the opponent. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Negation and Flare of Denial to protect the combo. The mana base includes various lands to ensure consistency and versatility in casting spells.

The deck aims to utilize the synergy between creatures like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to generate mana and create a board presence. It combines powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End with equipment like Blade of the Bloodchief to overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes support cards like Kozilek's Command and Urza's Saga to further enhance the combo potential. By efficiently ramping and creating a threatening board presence, the deck aims to establish dominance and win the game through a quick and powerful combo.

The key concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Control - UrzaTron deck is to establish control through powerful artifacts such as Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, while utilizing the Urza lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to ramp into powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Dismember and All Is Dust, while also presenting a fast clock with creatures like Sire of Seven Deaths and Devourer of Destiny.

The deck focuses on assembling a combination of creatures such as Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker, along with powerful support cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to create a devastating board state. The inclusion of Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga allows for quick mana generation and potent threats, while cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista provide additional win conditions. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a synergistic mix of creatures, spells, and enchantments while leveraging the combo potential of Broodscale Bloodchief.

Focused on disrupting the opponent's game plan, Dimir Control aims to counter spells, remove threats, and control the board until it can establish a dominant position. With a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures, this deck forces the opponent to play on the defensive while setting up for a powerful finish with cards like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's dual-color requirements and ensure consistency in drawing the necessary resources to maintain control throughout the game.

The main idea of this UR Aggro deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent with low-cost, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler. The deck aims to quickly build up board presence and deal damage using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. Mishra's Bauble allows for card advantage and Expressive Iteration helps with card selection. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and aggressive, aiming to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or set up their own strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and play big Eldrazi threats. The key strategy is to control the game through removal spells and disruptive effects like Thought-Knot Seer, while also using Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opponent's artifacts. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provides additional control options, while Devourer of Destiny and Glaring Fleshraker serve as aggressive win conditions. The deck's synergy lies in its ability to generate massive amounts of mana early on and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on assembling the Amulet Titan combo quickly and efficiently using cards like Arboreal Grazer, Primeval Titan, and Amulet of Vigor. It aims to generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful spells like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble, while using lands like Urza's Saga and Gruul Turf to gain an advantage. The deck also includes various utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Tolaria West to search for key pieces. Overall, the deck is designed to quickly ramp up and overwhelm opponents with its powerful combo potential.

This deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's game plan while building up a board presence with creatures that have powerful abilities. It utilizes a mix of removal spells, protection spells, and creatures that generate value over time. The goal is to outvalue the opponent while maintaining control of the board, using cards like Solitude and Teferi, Time Raveler to protect key threats and disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck's mana base is designed to support its strategies efficiently, ensuring it can consistently cast its spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand back from the graveyard quickly. By using cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler to control the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and instant speed interaction. With a mix of removal spells like Prismatic Ending and disruption like Thoughtseize, this deck is designed to combo off and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost artifact creatures and leveraging them with various artifacts and spells to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The synergy between the artifacts and creatures allows for explosive starts and potential for quick wins. The inclusion of cards like Urza's Saga and Emry, Lurker of the Loch provide additional value and card advantage, while cards like Tormod's Crypt and Engineered Explosives offer disruption and removal options. The deck's strategy revolves around efficiently utilizing artifacts to create a powerful board presence and outpace the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and other artifacts to overwhelm the opponent with a low mana curve and explosive plays. It utilizes cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up mana, while also using cards like Thoughtcast to draw extra cards. Urza's Saga is a key land card that helps to search for important artifacts to create a powerful board presence. The main strategy revolves around aggressive attacking and disrupting the opponent with cards like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive plays, utilizing low-cost creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, backed up by efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to draw cards and find the right answers, the deck aims to maintain a constant pressure on the opponent while constantly replenishing resources. The mana base includes fetch lands like Arid Mesa and Bloodstained Mire to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors.

This aggressive UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear while using cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to deal damage to the opponent. By maximizing the use of efficient creatures and burn spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a fast victory. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help with card selection and maximizing resources, while cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter provide additional threats and disruption. Overall, the deck is designed to be fast, efficient, and relentless in its attacks.

This deck focuses on utilizing the UrzaTron lands to ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells, aiming to disrupt the opponent's game plan and establish dominance on the battlefield. The key strategy involves assembling the UrzaTron lands as quickly as possible to cast high-impact threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator, while using control spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck also includes powerful board wipes like All Is Dust to maintain control of the game.

This deck aims to aggressively play creatures with high power and evasion, while also utilizing powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Consign to Memory to control the board. The deck also includes Leyline cards to further support its aggressive strategy by providing additional damage and protection. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multiple color requirements, allowing for flexibility in casting powerful multicolor spells. By combining aggressive creatures, removal, and mana fixing, this deck seeks to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence and applying pressure on the opponent with aggressive creature drops like Psychic Frog, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Scion of Draco. It also aims to control the tempo of the game with disruption spells like Lightning Bolt, Consign to Memory, and Stubborn Denial. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provide additional protection for your creatures while cards like Quantum Riddler and Vexing Bauble offer card advantage. The deck also includes a variety of lands to support its multicolor requirements and maximize mana efficiency.

The deck revolves around quickly assembling lands like Urza's Saga, Lotus Field, and Gruul Turf to ramp into powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and trigger combo pieces like Amulet of Vigor. By utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Scapeshift, the deck aims to generate extreme value and overwhelm opponents with a combination of creature power and land synergies. Through careful planning and efficient mana usage, the deck can create explosive board states and win conditions that can catch opponents off guard and secure victory.

The primary focus of this deck is to efficiently ramp into Primeval Titan and utilize Amulet of Vigor to generate multiple land drops per turn, allowing for explosive plays with cards like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble. The deck also includes various utility lands and spells to support the combo strategy, such as Urza's Saga for tutoring key cards and Boseiju, Who Endures for protecting important spells from counterspells. This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of big creatures and powerful land-based synergies.

The main focus of this Dimir control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through the use of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Psychic Frog to generate card advantage and outvalue the opponent. By using a mix of disruption and card advantage, the deck aims to control the game and power through to victory. Additionally, the deck utilizes a diverse land base to ensure consistency and flexibility in its mana base.

The focus of this deck revolves around disrupting your opponent's plans while applying pressure through aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation to control the board and protect your creatures, combined with a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Consign to Memory, you aim to keep your opponent on the back foot. With the support of efficient creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Psychic Frog, you can quickly close out the game before your opponent can recover.

This deck utilizes a combination of instant reanimation spells and powerful creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, you can cheat creatures like Griselbrand into play early on. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation help protect your combo pieces. A diverse land base allows for flexibility in mana production. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a win.

This deck focuses on quickly and efficiently reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with instant speed removal and counterspells. The combination of Atraxa, Grand Unifier, Psychic Frog, and Quantum Riddler can create a lock on the opponent's resources, allowing for a clear path to victory through overwhelming card advantage and board presence. The deck is designed to win through a powerful combo and controlling the game until that combo can be established.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Atraxa and Griselbrand, then using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a surprise attack. Cards like Faithful Mending and Tainted Indulgence help with card draw and graveyard manipulation. Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog provide some disruption for the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Thoughtseize to control the board. Overall, the strategy revolves around comboing off and reanimating powerful creatures for a quick win.

This deck focuses on a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game while applying pressure to the opponent. Cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury can quickly end the game if left unchecked, while cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Solitude provide answers to threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to establish board dominance early on and maintain it through a mix of removal, disruption, and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom, while controlling the game with counterspells like Disrupting Shoal and Flare of Denial. It also includes a variety of utility cards to help dig for combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to win the game quickly and efficiently without relying on traditional land cards.

This deck relies on using artifacts and counterspells to disrupt opponents while aiming to assemble the Goblin Charbelcher combo for a quick win. The key strategy is to control the board with disruptive cards like Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation while ramping up mana with Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention. By utilizing cards like Jwari Disruption and Waterlogged Teachings, the deck can ensure the combo pieces are protected until they can be assembled. Overall, the deck focuses on fast and efficient combo plays to overwhelm opponents in a landless engine.

This deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost aggressive creatures and spells to pressure the opponent. By utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear alongside burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the goal is to deal damage quickly and efficiently to win the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck also includes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration for card advantage and selection to keep the pressure on. The mana base is built to support casting spells quickly and efficiently to maintain aggression throughout the game.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, along with efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to apply early pressure and maintain card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration. The deck utilizes a mix of cheap spells and creatures to overwhelm opponents and secure a fast victory. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to both red and blue mana sources to cast spells efficiently.

Fast and aggressive creatures coupled with low-cost burn spells and combat tricks to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal significant damage in a short amount of time. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game and finish them off before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a defense. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help to ensure a consistent flow of threats and spells to keep the opponent on the back foot.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control through powerful Eldrazi creatures and efficient removal spells, supported by the UrzaTron lands for mana acceleration. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker while gradually building up to devastating threats like Sire of Seven Deaths. Karn, the Great Creator provides utility by shutting down artifact-based strategies, while Ugin, Eye of the Storms offers board control. The deck also incorporates ways to search for specific lands and cards to ensure consistency in its game plan.
